title: CHURCH / MAINFRAME
description: Mainframe. Related to Doomed-Soona-questline related stuff.

dialogueTree.title: Mainframe: "Machine's keyboard is still illumin..."
dialogueTree.text: Machine's keyboard is still illuminated, revealing virescent PLAY and PRINT buttons.

links.title: You: "Look inside the compartment."
links.text: Look inside the compartment.

links.title: Mainframe: "Behind the hatch sits a cube-like c..."
links.text: Behind the hatch sits a cube-like crisscross of filaments, smouldering in the dark like fireflies. Silver tape on the side says in black marker: "LOG (FEB-MAR)".

links.title: Interfacing: "Another filament memory. Press PLAY..."
links.text: Another filament memory. Press PLAY to talk with the repeater.

links.title: Interfacing: "This is the machine's filament memo..."
links.text: This is the machine's filament memory. Press PLAY to access its contents.

links.title: You: "Press PLAY."
links.text: Press PLAY.

links.title: Mainframe: "The speaker comes to life, static s..."
links.text: The speaker comes to life, static seeps through the machine's planar magnetic driver. An old lady greets you, her voice sounds a hundred years old...

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Good morning, Fortress Accident on..."
links.text: "Good morning, Fortress Accident on Saint-Brune, this is the East-Insulindian Repeater Station 1. Please repeat, is this the personal log?"

links.title: You: ""Yvonne, it's me again! How are you?""
links.text: "Yvonne, it's me again! How are you?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Good, thank you." It's not clear w..."
links.text: "Good, thank you." It's not clear whether she recognizes your voice. "Please repeat, is this the personal log?"

links.title: You: ""Let's try this again. I think I ma..."
links.text: "Let's try this again. I think I may have the right password for the personal log."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Good. Please repeat the password.""
links.text: "Good. Please repeat the password."

links.title: You: ""After life death.""
links.text: "After life death."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Good, I've unlocked the filament...."
links.text: "Good, I've unlocked the filament. After ending the call please press PRINT to access the filament."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Fortress Accident, is there anythi..."
links.text: "Fortress Accident, is there anything else I can do for you today?"

links.title: You: ""A password? I'm really bad at pass..."
links.text: "A password? I'm really bad at passwords. Can you give me a hint?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Still no.""
links.text: "Still no."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "A hint system is not part of the pr..."
links.text: A hint system is not part of the protocol for repeater stations.

links.title: You: ""Is it my birthday?""
links.text: "Is it my birthday?"

links.title: You: ""This is the police. Please open th..."
links.text: "This is the police. Please open this thing!"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: "The voice recites: "I am contractua..."
links.text: The voice recites: "I am contractually obliged to protect the privacy of the filament holder Fortress Accident. Without filing a warrant with Lintel I cannot give you access to this filament."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm afraid we're not doing that. U..."
links.text: "I'm afraid we're not doing that. Unless we want to wait for a month."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Now, can you please repeat the pas..."
links.text: "Now, can you please repeat the password?" the voice in the machine asks again. She sounds cold in the damp air.

links.title: You: ""I don't know the password.""
links.text: "I don't know the password."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Received. I will *register* this l..."
links.text: "Received. I will *register* this log-in attempt."

links.title: Half Light: "That sounds bad -- a log-in *attemp..."
links.text: That sounds bad -- a log-in *attempt*. Something a criminal would do.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's look around. There's no use..."
links.text: "Let's look around. There's no use trying to guess the answer."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe *he* knows something." The l..."
links.text: "Maybe *he* knows something." The lieutenant nods toward Tiago.

links.title: Logic: "Password. Of course it would have a..."
links.text: Password. Of course it would have a password. That's why there's a human administrator involved.

links.title: Suggestion: "You should ask her for a hint."
links.text: You should ask her for a hint.

links.title: You: ""I looked inside the core, but the..."
links.text: "I looked inside the core, but the tape on the filament just said "LOG (FEB-MAR)".

links.title: You: ""Sorry, I forgot to look inside the..."
links.text: "Sorry, I forgot to look inside the core to check what filament is inside."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Please end the call and do that.""
links.text: "Please end the call and do that."

links.title: You: ""I looked inside the core, but the..."
links.text: "I looked inside the core, but the tape on the filament just said "LOG (FEB-MAR)"."

links.title: You: ""What's 'the personal log'?""
links.text: "What's 'the personal log'?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""The filament you have inserted int..."
links.text: "The filament you have inserted into the core."

links.title: You: ""You mean that glowing thing with a..."
links.text: "You mean that glowing thing with a tape on it that said "LOG (FEB-MAR)"?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""I don't know, that's what I'm aski..."
links.text: "I don't know, that's what I'm asking. Is this the personal log?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""I don't know, maybe?""
links.text: "I don't know, maybe?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: "The old lady sighs, as a wave of st..."
links.text: The old lady sighs, as a wave of static distorts her voice to a robotic sprawl. "If you are unsure, could you please take a look?"

links.title: You: ""How do I do that?""
links.text: "How do I do that?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Open the hatch on the compartment...."
links.text: "Open the hatch on the compartment. Don't touch the wires, a current is running through it, but the core is safe. There's a filament inside -- I need to know what it's called."

links.title: You: ""It just says 'LOG (FEB-MAR)' and n..."
links.text: "It just says 'LOG (FEB-MAR)' and nothing else."

links.title: You: ""What do I get out of it?""
links.text: "What do I get out of it?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""After you've told me the filament'..."
links.text: "After you've told me the filament's name and password you can access its contents."

links.title: You: ""Alright, I'll do that.""
links.text: "Alright, I'll do that."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Yes. First you have to end this ca..."
links.text: "Yes. First you have to end this call though, and then you have to call us back. Is there anything else I could do for you meanwhile?"

links.title: You: ""I swear I haven't touched anything!""
links.text: "I swear I haven't touched anything!"

links.title: You: ""Ah, right. Thanks for the explanat..."
links.text: "Ah, right. Thanks for the explanation."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""That was a question. Have you inse..."
links.text: "That was a question. Have you inserted it into the core?"

links.title: You: ""Fortress Accident... like the one..."
links.text: "Fortress Accident... like the one in the Doomed Commercial Area?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""I have two machines registered to..."
links.text: "I have two machines registered to this company name in Martinaise -- one on Saint-Brune, the other on Rue de Saint-Ghislaine."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Saint-Brune -- that's the church,"..."
links.text: "Saint-Brune -- that's the church," the lieutenant gestures around him, "and Rue de Saint-Ghislaine, that's the Doomed Commercial Area."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Anything else I can help you with?""
links.text: "Anything else I can help you with?"

links.title: Logic: "Saint-Brune -- that's the church; R..."
links.text: Saint-Brune -- that's the church; Rue de Saint-Ghislaine -- the Doomed Commercial Area.

links.title: You: ""What's Fortress Accident?""
links.text: "What's Fortress Accident?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""The company on whose name the term..."
links.text: "The company on whose name the terminal you're currently using has been registered to."

links.title: You: ""Do you have any other information..."
links.text: "Do you have any other information about this company?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""One moment..." You hear her flip t..."
links.text: "One moment..." You hear her flip through a catalogue, before she reads out with studious care:

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""'Fortress Accident SCA produces re..."
links.text: "'Fortress Accident SCA produces revolutionary interactive call-in radio games' -- that's what the catalogue says."

links.title: Conceptualization: "That's not bad."
links.text: That's not bad.

links.title: You: ""Wow. So conceptual.""
links.text: "Wow. So conceptual."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""I wouldn't know, I'm only here for..."
links.text: "I wouldn't know, I'm only here for passwords."

links.title: You: ""And what's that -- this 'interacti..."
links.text: "And what's that -- this 'interactive call-in radio game'?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: "The static drowns her response. "An..."
links.text: The static drowns her response. "Any other questions?" you hear her ask when the connection finally improves.

links.title: You: ""What are you, a *machine*? Or are..."
links.text: "What are you, a *machine*? Or are you *alive*?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Yes, I am alive. I am 74 years old..."
links.text: "Yes, I am alive. I am 74 years old and my name is Yvonne."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant whispers into your e..."
links.text: The lieutenant whispers into your ear: "She repeats passwords. Programming people are all... paranoid."

links.title: You: ""Yvonne, my partner here tells me t..."
links.text: "Yvonne, my partner here tells me that you're here because radiocomputer guys are all paranoid."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""They're merely cautious," says the..."
links.text: "They're merely cautious," says the old lady. "It's my job to protect their filaments as a password repeater at the East-Insulindian Station."

links.title: Shivers: "On an island on the River Esperance..."
links.text: On an island on the River Esperance, a small woman, all skin and bones, sits in a room filled with audio equipment. Thousands of tiny lights are reflected back from her prescription lenses, like stars in the dark.

links.title: Empathy: "Doesn't it get lonely, sitting ther..."
links.text: Doesn't it get lonely, sitting there all by herself?

links.title: You: ""Doesn't it get lonely, doing this..."
links.text: "Doesn't it get lonely, doing this job?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Lonely?" For the first time you he..."
links.text: "Lonely?" For the first time you hear her chuckle through the rustle of static. "Why would it get lonely, I get to talk all day to people like you over a warm cup of tea."

links.title: Empathy: "That's why she does this."
links.text: That's why she does this.

links.title: You: "Let it go."
links.text: Let it go.

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Now please tell me if there's anyt..."
links.text: "Now please tell me if there's anything else I can do for you, Fortress Accident."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Now please tell me why you're call..."
links.text: "Now please tell me why you're calling, Fortress Accident."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but where are you? How did y..."
links.text: "Okay, but where are you? How did you know where I am?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""I work as a repeater at the East-I..."
links.text: "I work as a repeater at the East-Insulindian Repeater Station. It's my job to know where you are, Fortress Accident."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""As for me, well..." Some static. T..."
links.text: "As for me, well..." Some static. Then... "I am sitting in my cubicle surrounded by a wall of radios."

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Yes, I am alive. I am 74 years old..."
links.text: "Yes, I am alive. I am 74 years old and my name is Yvonne. Now please repeat, is this the personal log?"

links.title: You: ""Thanks, but I'm finished with this..."
links.text: "Thanks, but I'm finished with this call." (Press OFF/SILENT.)

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Good bye, Fortress Accident," she..."
links.text: "Good bye, Fortress Accident," she says as her voice disappears into a whirl of static.

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Sleep well, Fortress Accident," sh..."
links.text: "Sleep well, Fortress Accident," she says as her voice disappears into a whirl of static.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "It's the same old woman you spoke w..."
links.text: It's the same old woman you spoke with through the radiocomputer in the Doomed Commercial Area.

links.title: Logic: "Fortress Accident, just like in the..."
links.text: Fortress Accident, just like in the Doomed Commercial Area... There must be a connection.

links.title: Interfacing: "This is a *human interface* -- a re..."
links.text: This is a *human interface* -- a retired person sitting behind a switchboard somewhere.

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Good afternoon, Fortress Accident..."
links.text: "Good afternoon, Fortress Accident on Saint-Brune, this is the East-Insulindian Repeater Station 1. Please repeat, is this the personal log?"

links.title: East-Insulindian Repeater Station: ""Good evening, Fortress Accident on..."
links.text: "Good evening, Fortress Accident on Saint-Brune, this is the East-Insulindian Repeater Station 1. Please repeat, is this the personal log?"

links.title: Mainframe: "A bar of fabric right above the key..."
links.text: A bar of fabric right above the keyboard starts producing a soft hum. The sound of static seeps through the machine's planar magnetic driver.

links.title: Half Light: "Oh no... it was already glowing and..."
links.text: Oh no... it was already glowing and now it's also making a *sound*? It's probably some alien Seolite technology...

links.title: Mainframe: "The static gets louder, slowly fill..."
links.text: The static gets louder, slowly filling up the abandoned hall. Until a voice speaks out, crackling and old, cutting into the air...

links.title: You: "Press PLAY again."
links.text: Press PLAY again.

links.title: You: "Press PRINT."
links.text: Press PRINT.

links.title: Mainframe: "The printer prints out a long text..."
links.text: The printer prints out a long text document with dated paragraphs. It looks a bit like someone's journal.

links.title: Mainframe: "Nothing happens."
links.text: Nothing happens.

links.title: You: "Read the printout."
links.text: Read the printout.

links.title: Mainframe: "The first entry, made on the 4th Fe..."
links.text: The first entry, made on the 4th February '51 by an unknown author, is short and concise:

links.title: Mainframe: ""Arrived at the church. The door wa..."
links.text: "Arrived at the church. The door was boarded up, so I used a crowbar to get inside. Looks like the place has been deserted. Nothing out of the ordinary, but I'll ask around. Need to figure out how to get the electricity in."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant leans closer, scouri..."
links.text: The lieutenant leans closer, scouring the printout over your shoulder. Just as you finish reading he looks up, muttering under his breath:

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fourth of February? That's over a..."
links.text: "Fourth of February? That's over a month ago... Whoever set up those machines has been here for quite a while."

links.title: You: ""Do you think this log might be con..."
links.text: "Do you think this log might be connected to the case?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Our case? No, I don't think so. It..."
links.text: "Our case? No, I don't think so. It must be some local..." his eyes wander to the various machines around him, "*eccentric*."

links.title: You: "Read the second entry."
links.text: Read the second entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""6th FEB, '51: Had a little chat wi..."
links.text: "6th FEB, '51: Had a little chat with the local fishermen. Said I shouldn't go near that place, that the church was *spooky* and ridden with *narcotics*. It's a little spooky, alright. Still haven't figured out the electricity."

links.title: Half Light: "See? Even one of the spookers thems..."
links.text: See? Even one of the spookers themselves says it's unnerving.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What was that about narcotics? This..."
links.text: What was that about narcotics? This could prove to be interesting.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "See -- *ridden* with narcotics. Jus..."
links.text: See -- *ridden* with narcotics. Just like Andre said.

links.title: You: ""Wait, *narcotics*?" (Look around t..."
links.text: "Wait, *narcotics*?" (Look around the derelict building.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I doubt that we can find any. It's..."
links.text: "I doubt that we can find any. It's just idle fishermen's gossip to scare away the kids." He looks at the stained glass window.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Nothing *spooky* about this place..."
links.text: "Nothing *spooky* about this place either, it's just abandoned. And cold. And in an awful part of town..."

links.title: Drama: "Then why doth the lieutenant protes..."
links.text: Then why doth the lieutenant protest against spending time here? So often?

links.title: You: "Read the third entry."
links.text: Read the third entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""7th FEB, '51: Finally got the elec..."
links.text: "7th FEB, '51: Finally got the electricity in! Next on the agenda: a new antenna. I'm thinking ESKER series? Something advanced."

links.title: You: ""Why would she need an antenna?""
links.text: "Why would she need an antenna?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why would anyone need *any* of thi..."
links.text: "Why would anyone need *any* of this equipment here?" He steps on a wire running on the ground, inspecting it with his boot.

links.title: Interfacing: "For setting up her radiocomputer."
links.text: For setting up her radiocomputer.

links.title: You: "Read the fourth entry."
links.text: Read the fourth entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""8th FEB, '51: Bought the antenna,..."
links.text: "8th FEB, '51: Bought the antenna, had some problems setting it up, called Simo for help. Heard the others are back to *making art* (drinking somewhere out of town). Sulisaw started a rock band again, Lexie has been seen asking money from strangers..."

links.title: Authority: "Artists, yet again!! Harassing citi..."
links.text: Artists, yet again!! Harassing citizens, stealing badges, 'occupying' public spaces with 'installations' like the one here...

links.title: Mainframe: ""But at least the artists have thei..."
links.text: "But at least the artists have their act together -- they're qualified labour, they can get work anywhere: graphic design, ads. The programmers are doing fine too, I mean, they're programmers. The writers, though... they're fucked."

links.title: Mainframe: ""I just have to find out what cause..."
links.text: "I just have to find out what caused that data loss and be done with it. Still don't understand how it managed to wipe out the backup when the backup *wasn't even connected to the front*. I know, I know... everyone thinks it's impossible; they say I must be lying. I'm here to set it right."

links.title: Logic: "She must be talking about her forme..."
links.text: She must be talking about her former colleagues from Fortress Accident. They all sound like *radio game people*.

links.title: You: ""A data loss?""
links.text: "A data loss?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Seems like something to do with ra..."
links.text: "Seems like something to do with radiocomputers -- unfortunately, I don't know enough about them to understand what the author is saying."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Something about the backup data ge..."
links.text: "Something about the backup data getting destroyed... and how everyone thought it was the author's fault." He adjusts his glasses. "Let's just keep reading."

links.title: You: ""Artists, programmers, *Lexie* -- w..."
links.text: "Artists, programmers, *Lexie* -- who are all those people?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think these people worked in the..."
links.text: "I think these people worked in the radiocomputer games business. The one we saw in the Doomed Commercial Area. They must be her former co-workers."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Her friends, colleagues?" He shrug..."
links.text: "Her friends, colleagues?" He shrugs. "She must be quite educated if she knew how to set up all this machinery."

links.title: You: "Read the fifth entry."
links.text: Read the fifth entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""12th FEB, '51: Brought some food f..."
links.text: "12th FEB, '51: Brought some food from the grocery store. Apparently there's a strike going on in the harbour. Definitely not happy to see the Martinaise people again. Everything's now set up in the church, going to start working tomorrow 8 AM."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The strike..." He strokes his chin..."
links.text: "The strike..." He strokes his chin. "We're nearing the date of the murder."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Keep reading, I'm interested now -..."
links.text: "Keep reading, I'm interested now -- I want to know what's that radio anomaly that sent this person here in the first place."

links.title: You: "Read the sixth entry."
links.text: Read the sixth entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""25th FEB, '51: I've been sending d..."
links.text: "25th FEB, '51: I've been sending data up to Lintel for a while now, trying to recreate the data loss, but nothing. Didn't even feel like logging in the disappointment. But I did discover a curious *audio-spatial* anomaly at the back of the church. I've named it *the swallow*. (It swallows sound.) Need to get some mics."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Is she talking about...?" The lieu..."
links.text: "Is she talking about...?" The lieutenant looks to his right, toward the silence.

links.title: You: "Read the seventh entry."
links.text: Read the seventh entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""28th FEB, '51: Yes, the first reco..."
links.text: "28th FEB, '51: Yes, the first recordings confirm that the swallow is real and I'm not just losing my mind. It's a pillar of silence with a diameter of approximately three meters. Seems like the higher I go, the less I record. This might be a coincidence. Or it *could* be connected to the data loss that led me here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The pillar of silence! She *is* ta..."
links.text: "The pillar of silence! She *is* talking about the silence... Is she suggesting it's more than just an architectural quirk?"

links.title: You: ""But what could it be?" (Look at th..."
links.text: "But what could it be?" (Look at the water basins behind you.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant doesn't answer. He f..."
links.text: The lieutenant doesn't answer. He follows your gaze, studying the basins. The water shines in them. No ripples.

links.title: You: "Read the eighth entry."
links.text: Read the eighth entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""MARCH, '51: Some kind of young *di..."
links.text: "MARCH, '51: Some kind of young *discomen* have appeared next to the church. I've been trying to record the silence to find the epicentre, but now it turns out I've also been capturing the future of dance music, one neo-disco song over and over again..."

links.title: Mainframe: ""Fortunately, the song is so monoto..."
links.text: "Fortunately, the song is so monotonous I was able to devise an algorithm to factor it out. The other day one of the discomen came in. Before I could even say hello, she got scared and left. Good, I don't want anyone distracting me from my work."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "That discoman? Must be Acele."
links.text: That discoman? Must be Acele.

links.title: You: ""She must be describing Acele.""
links.text: "She must be describing Acele."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The girl on the ice? Sounds like h..."
links.text: "The girl on the ice? Sounds like her, yes."

links.title: You: "Read the ninth entry."
links.text: Read the ninth entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""MARCH '51: I got a call from the r..."
links.text: "MARCH '51: I got a call from the repeater station. Someone has tried to access the radiocomputer in our old office in Martinaise. Can't do anything about it; the storekeeper still doesn't want to let me inside the building. Thinks I'm part of some kind of *curse*. How Martinaise of her."

links.title: You: ""That's me. I was the one who broke..."
links.text: "That's me. I was the one who broke into that radiocomputer! And the storekeeper must be Plaisance..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I knew it wasn't a good idea to me..."
links.text: "I knew it wasn't a good idea to meddle with that machine..."

links.title: Interfacing: "No-no. It was a great idea. You're..."
links.text: No-no. It was a great idea. You're learning things. This is how you learn things about machines.

links.title: You: "Read the tenth entry."
links.text: Read the tenth entry.

links.title: Mainframe: ""MARCH '51: A new 2m AUX cable, noo..."
links.text: "MARCH '51: A new 2m AUX cable, noodles, crackers, Ping-Ping energy drinks, water, TOOTHPASTE, gum, also some canned air..."

links.title: Perception: "Your reading is interrupted by the..."
links.text: Your reading is interrupted by the sound of the church door opening.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "A strange woman makes straight for..."
links.text: A strange woman makes straight for the radiocomputer.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Breaking into my radiocomputer aga..."
links.text: "Breaking into my radiocomputer again, I see." She glares at you as she holds down the OFF button for several seconds. The machine reboots.

links.title: Interfacing: "Yes, you *are* breaking in. But not..."
links.text: Yes, you *are* breaking in. But not into *her* radiocomputer. You're a master circuit-bender.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I do apologize for the intrusion,..."
links.text: "I do apologize for the intrusion, madam. We're with the RCM, you see."

links.title: You: ""I can assure you I'm an expert cir..."
links.text: "I can assure you I'm an expert circuit-bender. I'm not breaking into your computer, I'm using it to access Coalition military datalinks."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""There are no *Coalition military d..."
links.text: "There are no *Coalition military datalinks*." She barely looks up from the keyboard. "And even if there was, you couldn't access them over a civilian network."

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'm actually trying to locat..."
links.text: "Okay, I'm actually trying to locate a suspect in a murder investigation. I thought they might be hiding here. I'm with the RCM, you see."

links.title: You: ""Yes, I could -- I'm a cybernetic g..."
links.text: "Yes, I could -- I'm a cybernetic god. I'm using the network to commandeer Coalition Warship Archer. I will turn its cannons against its masters."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""That's nonsense. You're just a pol..."
links.text: "That's nonsense. You're just a police officer." She barely looks up from the keyboard. You hear the machine whir back to life.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Now please, give me some room. I n..."
links.text: "Now please, give me some room. I need two seconds to see that you haven't destroyed anything."

links.title: You: ""You're right, I'm just a drunk cop..."
links.text: "You're right, I'm just a drunk cop. I don't know how to do anything interesting with radiocomputers."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No one asked you to do anything *i..."
links.text: "No one asked you to do anything *interesting* with my radiocomputer." She barely looks up from the keyboard. You hear the machine whir back to life.

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for a suspect in a mur..."
links.text: "I'm looking for a suspect in a murder investigation. I thought they might be hiding here. I'm with the RCM, you see."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""No one's hiding here." She barely..."
links.text: "No one's hiding here." She barely looks up from the keyboard. You hear the machine whir back to life.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's just me and my computer -- an..."
links.text: "It's just me and my computer -- and it has been this way for weeks. Now please, give me some room. I need two seconds to see that you haven't destroyed anything."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should talk to her," the lieute..."
links.text: "We should talk to her," the lieutenant whispers, "after she has rebooted the machine."

links.title: You: ""I'm here on a side case, represent..."
links.text: "I'm here on a side case, representing certain music venue organisers. I'm with the RCM, you see."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Well, you won't find any music ven..."
links.text: "Well, you won't find any music venue organisers here." She barely looks up from the keyboard. You hear the machine whir back to life.

links.title: You: ""I'm not *just* breaking in! I'm pu..."
links.text: "I'm not *just* breaking in! I'm pursuing a mysterious lead, in search of my lost identity."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""You won't find any answers from he..."
links.text: "You won't find any answers from here." She barely looks up from the keyboard. You hear the machine whir back to life.

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Breaking into my radiocomputer, I..."
links.text: "Breaking into my radiocomputer, I see." She glares at you as she holds down the OFF button for several seconds. The machine reboots.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Psst, someone's coming...""
links.text: "Psst, someone's coming..."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "You're so engrossed in your reading..."
links.text: You're so engrossed in your reading that you don't even notice the sound of the door opening...

links.title: Shivers: "A shiver runs through you as you lo..."
links.text: A shiver runs through you as you look to your left, toward the silence.

links.title: You: "Let go of the printout."
links.text: Let go of the printout.

links.title: Mainframe: "The machine's keyboard is still ill..."
links.text: The machine's keyboard is still illuminated, revealing virescent PLAY and PRINT buttons.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Mainframe: "A machine stands in the corner, wat..."
dialogueTree.text: A machine stands in the corner, watched over by the figures on the stained glass window. It's turned on and quivering with soft electricity.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant doesn't say anything..."
links.text: The lieutenant doesn't say anything, but you can sense that he doesn't like you meddling with the machine.

links.title: You: ""Yes, but this machine looks just l..."
links.text: "Yes, but this machine looks just like the one in Doomed Commercial Area."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's also quite similar to the one..."
links.text: "It's also quite similar to the one we have down at the station. Must be the same model." He inspects the machine's framework, careful not to touch anything.

links.title: Interfacing: "The one you saw earlier was the Reh..."
links.text: The one you saw earlier was the Rehm Civic -- this is the Rehm *Prefect*, a model number RC7024, equipped with a Feld mainframe and a Rehm-compatible Interim printer.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Rehm Prefect is the governmenta..."
links.text: The Rehm Prefect is the governmental version of the commonly used Rehm Civic model. Although mostly based on the same technology, the Rehm Prefect is equipped with better noise attenuation circuits.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A quaint little box of radio waves."
links.text: A quaint little box of radio waves.

links.title: You: ""Yes, but what is this strange thin..."
links.text: "Yes, but what is this strange thing?" (Point at the machine.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A radiocomputer," the lieutenant r..."
links.text: "A radiocomputer," the lieutenant repeats a little impatiently, "we have one down at the station."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "And before you have time to ask: "N..."
links.text: And before you have time to ask: "No, I don't know how to operate it or what it's used for. Let's go."

links.title: Interfacing: "This is the Rehm Prefect radiocompu..."
links.text: This is the Rehm Prefect radiocomputer, a model number RC7024, equipped with a Feld mainframe and a Rehm-compatible Interim printer.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Rehm Prefect is the governmenta..."
links.text: The Rehm Prefect is the governmental version of the commonly used Rehm Civic model. Although mostly based on the same technology, the Rehm Prefect is equipped with better noise attenuation circuits.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A quaint little box of radio waves."
links.text: A quaint little box of radio waves.

links.title: You: ""Wait, let me just investigate it....."
links.text: "Wait, let me just investigate it..." (Step behind the computer.)

links.title: Mainframe: "You see virescent PLAY and PRINT bu..."
links.text: You see virescent PLAY and PRINT buttons on the keyboard. A hatch connected to the central compartment is wide open.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant says nothing. You se..."
links.text: The lieutenant says nothing. You see the machine's glowing frame reflected back from his diamond-shaped glasses. You're free to proceed.

links.title: You: ""You're right, let's get out of her..."
links.text: "You're right, let's get out of here." [Leave.]

links.title: You: "Step behind the machine."
links.text: Step behind the machine.

links.title: Mainframe: "As you step closer, you notice vire..."
links.text: As you step closer, you notice virescent PLAY and PRINT buttons on the keyboard. A hatch connected to the central compartment is wide open.

links.title: You: "Back off. [Leave.]"
links.text: Back off. [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Mainframe: "A machine stands in the corner, wat..."
dialogueTree.text: A machine stands in the corner, watched over by the figures on the stained glass window. It's turned on and quivering with soft electricity.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Another radiocomputer," says the l..."
links.text: "Another radiocomputer," says the lieutenant, stepping closer. "And this time it's already turned on." He seems cautious around the machine.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "These machines sometimes harbour tr..."
links.text: These machines sometimes harbour traps, he thinks -- alarm systems and the like. Let's be careful.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should probably let it be. This..."
links.text: "We should probably let it be. This little 'foray' bears little connection to the case, no?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should probably let it be. It's..."
links.text: "We should probably let it be. It's becoming clear that there's no trace of the suspect anywhere inside the church."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should leave; I doubt this plac..."
links.text: "We should leave; I doubt this place bears any connection to the case."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A radiocomputer," says the lieuten..."
links.text: "A radiocomputer," says the lieutenant, stepping closer. "And it's turned on." He seems cautious around the machine.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Another radiocomputer! Could it bea..."
links.text: Another radiocomputer! Could it bear connection to the one in the Doomed Commercial Area?

links.title: Interfacing: "This is the Rehm Prefect, radiocomp..."
links.text: This is the Rehm Prefect, radiocomputer model number RC7024, equipped with a Feld mainframe and a Rehm-compatible Interim printer.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Rehm Prefect is the governmenta..."
links.text: The Rehm Prefect is the governmental version of the commonly used Rehm Civic. Although mostly based on the same technology, the Rehm Prefect is equipped with better noise attenuation circuits.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Better not touch it. Who knows what..."
links.text: Better not touch it. Who knows what evils it may hide.

links.title: Conceptualization: "A quaint little box of radio waves."
links.text: A quaint little box of radio waves.
